facebook.message:
Attention Facebook Fans:  Lady Gaga February Concerts Cancelled

Live Nation Global Touring has confirmed that the February 19 and 20 Lady Gaga Born This Way Ball performances at Wells Fargo Center, as well as the remainder of the tour, have been cancelled.

After additional tests this morning to review the severity of the issue, it has been determined that Lady Gaga has a labral tear of the right hip. She will need surgery to repair the problem, followed by strict down time to recover. This unfortunately, will force her to cancel the tour so she can heal. 

Refunds for the cancelled performances will be available at the point of purchase starting Feb 14, 2013

interaction.content:

Live Nation Global Touring has confirmed that the February 19 and 20 Lady Gaga Born This Way Ball performances at Wells Fargo Center, as well as the remainder of the tour, have been cancelled.

After additional tests this morning to review the severity of the issue, it has been determined that Lady Gaga has a labral tear of the right hip. She will need surgery to repair the problem, followed by strict down time to recover. This unfortunately, will force her to cancel the tour so she can heal. 

Refunds for the cancelled performances will be available at the point of purchase starting Feb 14, 2013

facebook.description:
1.1¬† Terms and conditions:
This contest is being organized by Standard Chartered India (hereinafter called as "Organizer"). By entering the contest, participants (parent/legal guardian in the case of minors) acknowledge that they have read and understood, and unconditionally agree to comply with and abide by the Terms & conditions. The decisions of the Organizer for all matters relating to the contest shall be final and binding in all respects. This contest is not associated with www.facebook.com.
2.1¬† Contest eligibility and rules
The contest is open to all Indian residents. If the contestant is a minor, it is understood and the contestant hereby agrees that prior parental consent has been granted to enter this contest.
The contest is not open to (i) The employees (permanent or on contract) and directors of the Organizer, its parent, subsidiary and affiliated companies (ii) Advertising and promotion agencies, suppliers of prizes, and persons or entities connected with the promotion of the contest (collectively referred as "Sponsors"); and (iii) Persons who have an agreement or contract with any third parties that would prohibit such persons from participating in the contest.
The Organizer reserves the right to verify the eligibility of all participants. The Organizer also reserves the right to hold or withdraw the contest or change the rules without any prior notice.
The contest submissions will be judged based on the creativity, originality and in accordance to the contest theme.
2.1¬† Rules of the contestShare your ideas on the best valentine      offeroffer in not more than 500 characters.Ideas shared should be about      the best offer for the Valentine DayEvery participant is allowed to      submit only one entry.The participant needs to be an      Indian resident to be eligibleThe participant needs to be a      Fan of Standard Chartered India Facebook page.Organizer will review the entry submitted and if it is found to be fake entries/ multiple entries with fake profiles or obscene/vulgar or not related to the theme or against any of the rules and terms specified here ‚Äì then the entry will not be accepted for the contest.We will select one winner      everyday from 14th, 15th, 16th & 17th      Feb 2013¬† and the selected entry      would be entitled to win Lifestyle gift vouchers worth INR 250/- each, The participant must own all      legal rights for the submitted entry.The participant maintains the      rights to their submissions.The contest will be open from 14th      Feb 2013 till midnight of 17th Feb 2013Organizer reserves all the      rights to reject any entry if it is found violating any rule of the land.Organizer reserves all the      rights to withdraw the contest in case of any unforeseen circumstances.This contest is in no way      sponsored, endorsed or administered by, or associated with, Facebook.
¬†
3.1¬† Winners & Prizes
Winners: The contest will run till midnight on 17th Feb 2013.
Prizes: The schedule of prizes is as mentioned below. However the Organizer reserves the right to swap these prizes with alternates of equivalent value or even discontinue altogether under unforeseen circumstances. One daily winner prizes ‚Äì ¬†¬†Lifestyle vouchers worth INR250 each!
Winners Announcement: Winners will be announced on Facebook Post. Participants are requested to regularly check this section to know the winners.
Prize Dispatch: The Organizer shall contact winners via email (as mentioned in the participant's contest profile) asking for prize delivery address. The prize would be dispatched via courier to the address provided by the winner. , Please note there could be a scenario where the prize might need to be collected by the winner personally from Organizer's location. This would be informed to the winner. It would be Organizer's best endeavour to arrange prize collection from its outlet nearest to the winner's location.
Any tax or other liabilities or charges payable to the government or any other statutory authority/body or any participating establishment, which may arise or accrue to the winner due to provision of the Gift Offer, shall be to the sole account of the winner.
¬†
4.1¬† Contact Information
For any queries, you may write to us via theFacebook message box.
facebook.name: Terms & Conditions for the 'Valentine's Day Contest'

blog.content:
Published on: 2013-02-14 10:00:06


I think you should check out this article I found for this blog. Read it here ‚Äì Box Of Awesome Is Like A Free Birchbox For Kids Stuffed Full Of Games, Books, Music, And More

Serial games entrepreneur and sometimes angel investor Dylan Collins has a new project, which he no doubt describes as ‚Äúawesome‚Äù. Aiming to help solve the discovery problem faced by physical and digital products targeting the fickle market that is kids, the aptly named Box Of Awesome is like a free Birchbox for 13-14 year-old children, stuffed with games, music, books, and other kid-friendly stuff. The draw for brands who pay for space in each bi-monthly box is the opportunity to be discovered by influencers in that hard to reach demographic. To that end, I‚Äôm told that the startup has already amassed 30,000+ subscribers in the UK, where it is initially launching, and will begin sending out the first Box Of Awesome‚Äôs at the end of this month. The idea for the service was born out of Collins‚Äô experience in the games industry and most recently as Chairman of boys online game Fight My Monster . He realised that the challenge of targeting 13-14 year-old kids isn‚Äôt just creating content that resonates with them (before they move on to the next cool thing), but actually getting their attention in the first place. It‚Äôs a familiar problem faced by products in many markets: the barriers of distribution are much lower online, but discovery is now a lot harder as supply beats demand. One way to think about how Box Of Awesome is tackling this problem is akin to ‚Äògive aways‚Äô found on the covers of children‚Äôs magazines. And in fact, the scale that the company is gunning for in the UK is at least on par with that model, which it is directly competing with. In order to maintain the element of surprise ‚Äî in a call with Collins my reaction to his pitch was to describe the concept as ‚Äúlike Christmas every other month‚Äù ‚Äî the company is remaining tight-lipped about what exactly is in its first box. When pressed, however, Collins had this to say: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got a range of brands, so quite a bit of variety across the boxes, including major book publishers, collectibles (cards and figures), two music labels, two games publishers and one clothing company. And it‚Äôs not just about big brands. What‚Äôs really cool is that we‚Äôre also bringing two completely new companies to our community in the first box.‚Äù In other words, should Box Of Awesome pan out, it could potentially be a way for startups to not only use the service to help launch, but also to piggyback the bigger brands that make up the majority of the box and provide the pull to get kids interested in the first place. Presuming, of course, that the expense isn‚Äôt too prohibitive; currently it‚Äôs the brands that pick up the tab, though it‚Äôs conceivable that if there is enough demand a paid-for subscription model could be adopted to help soften this. ‚ÄúFundamentally, we‚Äôre curating a collection of genuinely awesome products for our community so it‚Äôs a great way of mixing established and new‚Äù, adds Collins. Alongside Collins, who is funding the startup via his private equity vehicle OMAC Investments, Box Of Awesome is co-founded by Nic Mitham, a virtual worlds marketing consultant. Prior to Box Of Awesome, Collins has founded and sold three companies: Jolt Online Gaming (acquired by GameStop), DemonWare (acquired by Activision Blizzard), and mobile messaging company Phorest (acquired by MBO).

Photos:
<>


See the original post here:
Box Of Awesome Is Like A Free Birchbox For Kids Stuffed Full Of Games, Books, Music, And More
